alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 1:21PM MST until January 17 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST TUESDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...Areas of rain and snow becoming steadier and heavy at times tonight. Snow levels initially around 6000-6500 feet but lowering to 3500-4000 feet by later Tuesday morning. Heaviest snow accumulations remain above 5500 feet, where additional snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches are possible through Tuesday evening, locally as high as 20 inches above 7500 feet. * WHERE...Areas above 5500 feet near Alpine, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Grand Canyon, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Pine-Strawberry, Pinetop-Lakeside, Prescott, Show Low, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to almost impossible at times. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Additional snow forecast from 1 PM Today to 11 PM Tuesday: Alpine 6 to 10 inches Doney Park 4 to 8 inches Flagstaff 9 to 15 inches Forest Lakes 15 to 21 inches Grand Canyon 4 to 6 inches Heber-Overgaard 2 to 4 inches Jacob Lake 9 to 13 inches North Rim 10 to 16 inches Pine-Strawberry 4 to 6 inches Pinetop-Lkside 8 to 12 inches Prescott 0 to 1 inches Show Low 3 to 5 inches Valle 1 to 3 inches Williams 8 to 12 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
